0: # INPUTimport jsondef extract_variables(text):      """      Extracts all variable names from the input text.      Parameters      ----------      text : str          The text containing the ABM code.      Returns      -------      list          A list of strings representing the variable names.      """      pattern = r"^\w+$"      matches = re.findall(pattern, text, flags=re.MULTILINE | re.DOTALL)      return matchesdef extract_variable_info(text):      """      Extracts the short description, data type, and initial value of each variable from the input text.      Parameters      ----------      text : str          The text containing the ABM code.      Returns      -------      dict          A dictionary where the keys are the variable names and the values are dictionaries containing the          short description, data type, and initial value of each variable.      """      variables = extract_variables(text)      variable_info = {}      for var in variables:          match = re.search(r"^(\w+) \[(.*?)\]", var)          if match:              var_name = match.group(1)              var_desc = match.group(2)              var_type = "string"              if "int" in var_desc:                  var_type = "integer"              var_init = 0              if "float" in var_desc:                  var_init = float(var_desc.split(".")[0])              variable_info[var_name] = {"short_description": var_desc, "data_type": var_type, "initial_value": var_init}      return variable_infodef main():      with open('abm.txt', 'r') as f:          text = f.read()      variable_info = extract_variable_info(text)      print(json.dumps(variable_info, indent=4))if __name__ == '__main__':      main()# OUTPUT# {#       "Model-Level": {#           "
1: #!/bin/python3import mathimport osimport randomimport reimport sys# Complete the abm_text function below.def abm_text():      # Read the input file      with open('abm_text.txt', 'r') as f:          lines = f.read().splitlines()      # Extracting the Model-Level Variables      model_variables = {}      for line in lines:          if "=" in line:              var_name, var_info = line.split("=", maxsplit=1)              var_info = var_info.strip()              var_info = var_info.replace(" ", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("\n", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("\t", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("\"", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("'", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("{", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("}", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("[", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("]", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("(", "")              var_info = var_info.replace(")", "")              var_info = var_info.replace(";", "")              var_info = var_info.replace(",", "")              var_info = var_info.replace(".", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("+", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("-", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("*", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("/", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("%", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("^", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("~", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("&", "")              var_info = var_info.replace("|",
